intro: Sickingia myriantha, commonly known as the woolly spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and striking, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is adapted to arid environments. Its succulent leaves store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. Sickingia myriantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
